channel.title: TCCSplashManager
channel.description:
This application allows you to change the splash image on TCC89x processor android pads. I have tested it on the HaiPad m701 and m1001 tablet but not on the others. If you find any bugs or have suggestions on improvement please let me know source code is included!
[b]Special Thanks:[/b] Frank_ (Fixing my mistake on a bit shift converting the TCCchecksum >> != >>>) FUKAUMI Naoki. Original author of TCCUtils
It allows:
[ul][li]Changing rom splash images[/li] [li]Save splash image from rom[/li][/ul]
[img]http://silabsoft.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/tccsplashmanager.png[/img]
http://silabsoft.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/TCCSplashManager.zip
[b]Warning: This is only tested for the HaiPad M701 its splash parameters are defaulted to this model if you change any of the splash parameters make sure to use a copy of your lk.rom I do not want to be held responsible if you cause your rom or device to divide by 0! :p happy testing[/b]

item.title: TCCSplashManager
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

This application allows you to change the splash image on TCC89x processor android pads. I have tested it on the HaiPad m701 and m1001 tablet but not on the others. If you find any bugs or have suggestions on improvement please let me know source code is included!

Special Thanks:
Frank_ (Fixing my mistake on a bit shift converting the TCCchecksum >> != >>>)
FUKAUMI Naoki. Original author of TCCUtils

It allows:

[ul][li]Changing rom splash images[/li]
[li]Save splash image from rom[/li][/ul]

http://silabsoft.org/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/TCCSplashManager.zip

Warning: This is only tested for the HaiPad M701 its splash parameters are defaulted to this model if you change any of the splash parameters make sure to use a copy of your lk.rom I do not want to be held responsible if you cause your rom or device to divide by 0! happy testing
